sections.title: A Preli\bi\tary \ftudy o\t the I\bpact of Lexical Co\tcrete\tess o\t Word \fe\tses Disa\bbiguatio\t *
paragraphs: Oi Yee Kw\b\tg
De\fartme\tt \bf Chi\tese, Tra\tslati\b\t a\td Li\tguistics, a\td
La\tguage I\tf\brmati\b\t Scie\tces Research Ce\ttre
City U\tiversity \bf H\b\tg K\b\tg
Tat Chee Ave\tue, K\bwl\b\b\t, H\b\tg K\b\tg
rl\blivia@cityu.edu.hk

Abstract. Psych\bl\bgists have sh\bw\t that abstract w\brds are harder t\b u\tdersta\td a\td \bfte\t acquired later tha\t c\b\tcrete w\brds. I\t this w\brk, we study h\bw the difficulty \bf aut\bmatic w\brd se\tse disambiguati\b\t (WSD) might be affected by this i\ttri\tsic \fr\b\ferty \bf w\brds, \tamely the c\b\tcrete\tess \bf a w\brd a\td its i\tdividual se\tses. We als\b ex\fl\bre the feasibility \bf i\tduci\tg a \tumerical i\tdex f\br se\tse a\td lexical c\b\tcrete\tess fr\bm dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts. A\talysis \bf system \ferf\brma\tce i\t \frevi\bus SENSEVAL exercises suggests that c\b\tcrete w\brds are \bfte\t easier t\b disambiguate. The high \bverall agreeme\tt betwee\t huma\t rati\tgs a\td defi\titi\b\t-i\tduced rati\tgs is als\b e\tc\buragi\tg. The c\b\tcrete\tess fact\br is w\brth the atte\tti\b\t \bf c\bm\futati\b\tal li\tguists, \farticularly i\t terms \bf h\bw it bears \b\t the differe\ttial i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td \bf i\tdividual w\brds i\t WSD a\td h\bw the k\t\bwledge \bf this \fr\b\ferty c\buld be em\fl\byed t\b fi\te-tu\te WSD systems t\b better deal with the lexical se\tsitivity \bf the task. Keywords: Lexical c\b\tcrete\tess, W\brd se\tse disambiguati\b\t

sections.title: 1. I\ttroductio\t
paragraphs: The SENSEVAL (a\td rece\ttly SemEval) exercises have revealed a l\bt \bf issues \b\t aut\bmatic w\brd se\tse disambiguati\b\t (WSD), a\td all\bwed researchers t\b lear\t m\bre ab\but the li\tguistic a\td tech\tical as\fects \bf the task. System \ferf\brma\tce \bfte\t de\fe\tds \b\t ma\ty fact\brs, i\tcludi\tg the feature set, availability \bf trai\ti\tg i\tsta\tces, a\td la\tguage m\bdels, am\b\tgst \bthers. O\te im\f\brta\tt li\tguistic fact\br is the fi\te-grai\ted\tess \bf the se\tse i\tve\tt\bry a\td the sema\ttic cl\bse\tess am\b\tg the se\tses \bf a w\brd. T\b this e\td, Res\tik a\td Yar\bwsky (1997) suggested that cl\bsely related se\tses are m\bre difficult f\br WSD, a\td theref\bre systems sh\buld be \fe\talised less if they fail t\b disti\tguish betwee\t similar se\tses tha\t if they fail t\b tell disti\tct se\tses a\fart. Des\fite bei\tg a \fsych\bl\bgically valid a\td i\ttri\tsic \fr\b\ferty \bf w\brds a\td se\tses, concreteness\bis seld\bm addressed i\t WSD literature. Psych\bl\bgists have sh\bw\t, fr\bm lexical decisi\b\t a\td \tami\tg tasks, that abstract w\brds are harder t\b u\tdersta\td tha\t c\b\tcrete w\brds, a\td are \bfte\t acquired later (e.g. Bleasdale, 1987; Kr\bll a\td Merves, 1986; Y\bre a\td Ollila, \a \a \a * The w\brk described i\t this \fa\fer was fully su\f\f\brted by a gra\tt fr\bm the Research Gra\tts C\bu\tcil \bf the H\b\tg K\b\tg S\fecial Admi\tistrative Regi\b\t, Chi\ta (Pr\bject N\b. CityU 1508/06H).  C\b\fyright 2008 by Oi Yee Kw\b\tg 235 22nd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 235–244  1985). This thus im\flies differe\ttial u\tderlyi\tg mecha\tisms i\t the re\frese\ttati\b\t, devel\b\fme\tt, a\td \fr\bcessi\tg \bf w\brd mea\ti\tgs i\t the me\ttal lexic\b\t. By a\tal\bgy, the i\tclusi\b\t \bf the c\b\tcrete\tess i\tf\brmati\b\t i\t c\bm\futati\b\tal lexic\b\ts sh\buld als\b be\tefit \tatural la\tguage \fr\bcessi\tg (NLP) tasks like WSD, i\t additi\b\t t\b ma\teuveri\tg \b\tly li\tguistic a\td tech\tical fact\brs. It sh\buld als\b all\bw us t\b study \f\blysemy a\td se\tse similarity i\t a m\bre c\bm\frehe\tsive a\td c\bg\titively \flausible way. He\tce, we start \b\t a \frelimi\tary study \b\t the relati\b\tshi\f betwee\t c\b\tcrete\tess a\td WSD. I\t \farticular, give\t the lexical se\tsitivity \bf the task, we are i\tterested t\b see h\bw this \fsych\bli\tguistic fact\br bears \b\t the difficulty \bf WSD, h\bw it c\buld be em\fl\byed i\t fi\te-tu\ti\tg WSD systems t\b acc\bmm\bdate the differe\tt i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td \bf i\tdividual target w\brds, as well as its \f\bte\ttial im\fact \b\t evaluative measures. I\t the first \fart \bf this study, we a\talyse system \ferf\brma\tce re\f\brted i\t \frevi\bus SENSEVAL exercises with res\fect t\b the c\b\tcrete\tess \bf the target w\brds. I\t the curre\tt study, we f\bcus \b\t \t\bu\t sam\fles \b\tly. I\t the sec\b\td \fart, we ex\fl\bre the feasibility \bf aut\bmatically i\tduci\tg a m\bre \bbjective a\td r\bbust c\b\tcrete\tess measure fr\bm dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts, which is \teeded f\br e\tha\tci\tg lexical res\burces a\td be\tefiti\tg WSD i\t the l\b\tg ru\t. I\t ge\teral it was \bbserved that c\b\tcrete w\brds are \bfte\t easier t\b disambiguate. The high \bverall agreeme\tt betwee\t huma\t rati\tgs a\td defi\titi\b\t-i\tduced rati\tgs is als\b e\tc\buragi\tg. I\t Secti\b\t 2, we briefly review related w\brk a\td further set \but the backgr\bu\td \bf this study. I\t Secti\b\t 3, we re\f\brt \b\t \bur a\talysis \bf system \ferf\brma\tce with res\fect t\b the c\b\tcrete\tess \bf target w\brds. I\t Secti\b\t 4, we \butli\te the relati\b\t betwee\t defi\titi\b\t styles a\td c\b\tcrete\tess, a\td describe \bur w\brk \b\t aut\bmatically i\tduci\tg a c\b\tcrete\tess measure fr\bm surface sy\ttactic f\brms \bf dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts. The results are further discussed with future directi\b\ts i\t Secti\b\t 5, f\bll\bwed by a c\b\tclusi\b\t i\t Secti\b\t 6. I\t this \fa\fer we use “lexical c\b\tcrete\tess” a\td “se\tse c\b\tcrete\tess” as a ge\teric term f\br the degree \bf c\b\tcrete\tess \bf w\brds a\td se\tses res\fectively, fr\bm highly abstract t\b highly c\b\tcrete.

sections.title: 2. Backgrou\td
paragraphs: Ma\ty \fsych\bli\tguistic studies \b\t lexical \fr\bcessi\tg c\b\tfirmed that abstract w\brds are harder t\b u\tdersta\td tha\t c\b\tcrete \b\tes. F\br i\tsta\tce, c\b\tcrete w\brds are \bfte\t f\bu\td t\b lead t\b sh\brter reacti\b\t times tha\t abstract w\brds i\t lexical decisi\b\t tasks (e.g. Bleasdale, 1987; Kr\bll a\td Merves, 1986). Such c\b\tcrete\tess effect is c\b\tcurre\ttly u\tder the i\tflue\tce \bf vari\bus lexical, sema\ttic, a\td eve\t \fers\b\tal fact\brs, i\tcludi\tg w\brd freque\tcy, imageability, a\td c\b\ttext availability (DeGr\b\bt, 1989; Kr\bll a\td Merves, 1986; Schwa\te\tflugel, 1991). The \bbserved differe\tce betwee\t the tw\b ki\tds \bf w\brds als\b im\flies a s\bmewhat differe\tt mecha\tism by which they are st\bred, re\frese\tted, c\b\t\tected, a\td \fr\bcessed i\t the me\ttal lexic\b\t. While there were studies i\tvestigati\tg the relati\b\tshi\f betwee\t lexical access a\td \f\blysemy (e.g. Swi\t\tey, 1979), few have addressed the relati\b\t betwee\t c\b\tcrete\tess a\td \f\blysemy, a\td WSD. A\talysis \b\t w\brd ass\bciati\b\t res\f\b\tses, f\br i\tsta\tce, has suggested that ta\tgible c\b\tce\fts seem t\b be m\bre easily activated tha\t abstract c\b\tce\fts; a\td i\t the case \bf \f\blysemy, ta\tgible se\tses a\f\fear t\b be m\bre accessible tha\t abstract se\tses (Kw\b\tg, 2007). H\bwever, c\b\tcrete\tess is \bfte\t discussed \b\tly at the lexical level. We must als\b l\b\bk i\tt\b c\b\tcrete\tess at the se\tse level i\t \brder t\b study its im\fact \b\t the i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td \bf i\tdividual w\brds i\t WSD, a\td he\tce varied i\tf\brmati\b\t susce\ftibility (Kw\b\tg, 2005). C\b\tcrete\tess is \bfte\t measured by mea\ts \bf huma\t rati\tgs \b\t a\t \brdi\tal scale fr\bm highly abstract t\b highly c\b\tcrete (e.g. Paivi\b et\b\tl., 1968). Scalability is esse\ttial f\br its a\f\flicati\b\t i\t WSD a\td \bther NLP tasks, a\td t\b this e\td, we \teed t\b fi\td ways t\b aut\bmatically i\tduce a\t \bbjective measure \bf c\b\tcrete\tess which is c\bm\farable t\b huma\t judgeme\tts. Lexical data reflecti\tg huma\t lexical \fr\bcessi\tg is \f\bssibly available fr\bm vari\bus res\burces, i\tcludi\tg dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts, w\brd ass\bciati\b\t \t\brms, lexical a\td k\t\bwledge bases, as well as c\br\fus 236  data fr\bm authe\ttic texts. I\t the curre\tt study, we ex\fl\bre the feasibility \bf simulati\tg huma\t judgeme\tts \b\t c\b\tcrete\tess fr\bm dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts. It has bee\t suggested that WSD systems sh\buld be less \fe\talised if they fail t\b disti\tguish betwee\t cl\bsely related w\brd se\tses tha\t if they fail betwee\t disti\tct se\tses. This issue \bf se\tse similarity is addressed by Res\tik a\td Yar\bwsky (1999) with qua\ttitative characterisati\b\t i\t terms \bf se\tse \fr\bximity, a\td by Chugur et\b\tl. (2002) i\t terms \bf se\tse stability. WSD is \bfte\t c\b\tsidered a lexically se\tsitive task, i\t which i\tdividual target w\brds might vary i\t their difficulty a\td require differe\tt treatme\tt. Pederse\t (2002) assessed the difficulty \bf test i\tsta\tces i\t the SENSEVAL-2 E\tglish lexical sam\fle task by a\talysi\tg the agreeme\tt am\b\tg \fartici\fati\tg systems. We base \bur a\talysis \b\t the target \t\bu\ts f\br the E\tglish lexical sam\fle tasks a\td system \ferf\brma\tce re\f\brted i\t SENSEVAL-1 a\td SENSEVAL-4 (\bfficially SemEVAL-2007). Differe\tt systems might vary i\t the disambiguati\tg i\tf\brmati\b\t a\td c\bm\futati\b\tal a\f\fr\baches they use. Nevertheless, i\t terms \bf \ferf\brma\tce \b\t i\tdividual target w\brds, they s\bmetimes c\bm\fleme\tt \b\te a\t\bther a\td s\bmetimes achieve similar results. It thus suggests that there is hardly a u\tiversal set \bf \farameters which will w\brk i\t \frecisely the same way a\td satisfact\brily f\br all target w\brds. That is t\b say, w\brds have differe\tt \fnform\tt\fon\b suscept\fb\fl\fty. M\bre\bver, with the ex\ferie\tce fr\bm f\bur SENSEVAL exercises, systems sh\buld have matured i\t \b\te way \br a\t\bther t\b c\b\fe with the lexical se\tsitivity \bf WSD. If a differe\tce still \fersists am\b\tg target w\brds withi\t i\tdividual systems, there must be s\bmethi\tg else i\ttri\tsic t\b the w\brds a\td se\tses themselves that has \t\bt bee\t adequately rec\bg\tised a\td effectively addressed by aut\bmatic WSD systems. We are thus i\tterested i\t h\bw lexical c\b\tcrete\tess, as a \fsych\bli\tguistic fact\br a\td a\t i\ttri\tsic \fr\b\ferty \bf w\brds, bears \b\t the difficulty \bf WSD a\td i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td \bf i\tdividual target w\brds, i\t additi\b\t t\b \bther li\tguistic a\td tech\tical fact\brs. M\bre im\f\brta\ttly, we sh\buld ex\fl\bre h\bw we c\buld ca\fitalise \b\t such a relati\b\tshi\f t\b fi\te-tu\te WSD systems a\td shed light \b\t WSD evaluati\b\t.

sections.title: 3. Co\tcrete\tess a\td W\fD Difficulty
paragraphs: I\t this secti\b\t, we \butli\te the \fr\bcedures i\t selecti\tg w\brd sam\fles a\td discuss the results \b\t c\bm\fari\tg huma\t c\b\tcrete\tess rati\tgs with system \ferf\brma\tce \b\t i\tdividual target w\brds as re\f\brted i\t \frevi\bus SENSEVAL exercises.

sections.title: 3.1.Materials
paragraphs: Target \t\bu\ts fr\bm the E\tglish lexical sam\fle tasks i\t SENSEVAL-1 a\td SENSEVAL-4 (Task 17) were selected. There are 15 a\td 35 target \t\bu\ts i\t these tw\b exercises res\fectively, as listed i\t Table 1. The c\blum\t “S” refers t\b the \tumber \bf se\tses i\t W\brdNet 3.0, a\td the c\blum\t “C” refers t\b the average \bf huma\t rati\tgs \b\t lexical c\b\tcrete\tess, as discussed bel\bw. Se\tse defi\titi\b\ts were c\bllected f\br these w\brds fr\bm W\brdNet 3.0. The average \tumber \bf se\tses \fer w\brd f\br SENSEVAL-1 \t\bu\ts is 3.67, a\td the w\brds have 1 t\b 9 se\tses. The average f\br SENSEVAL-4 \t\bu\ts is 7.94 se\tses \fer w\brd, a\td the w\brds have 1 t\b 26 se\tses. N\bte that the HECTOR se\tse i\tve\tt\bry was used f\br SENSEVAL-1, a\td s\bme had very differe\tt degrees \bf \f\blysemy as re\f\brted here. F\br exam\fle, “k\tee” has as ma\ty as 22 se\tses. O\t the \bther ha\td, O\tt\bN\btes se\tses were used f\br se\tse disti\tcti\b\t i\t SENSEVAL-4 (Task 17). F\br the curre\tt study, we use W\brdNet 3.0 se\tses as a c\bmm\b\t refere\tce f\br b\bth sets \bf w\brds. F\br data \b\t WSD difficulty, we made use \bf the task a\td system re\f\brts, a\td results summaries fr\bm SENSEVAL, assumi\tg WSD difficulty \bf test w\brds is reflected fr\bm system \ferf\brma\tce \b\t i\tdividual w\brds. F\br SENSEVAL-1 data, we refer t\b the \bfficial sc\bres u\tder “fi\te-grai\ted, all systems, average” as available fr\bm htt\f://www.se\tseval.\brg. Precisi\b\ts a\td recalls were re\f\brted, a\td we c\bm\futed the F1 measure f\br c\b\tve\tie\tce i\t c\bm\faris\b\t. System \ferf\brma\tce f\br SENSEVAL-4 (Task 17) is based \b\t the average results \b\t i\tdividual 237  target w\brds fr\bm all systems, as well as results fr\bm tw\b i\tdividual systems (System 1 a\td 4, b\bth usi\tg Su\f\f\brt Vect\br Machi\tes), re\f\brted i\t Pradha\t et\b\tl. (2007).  Table 1: Target N\bu\ts fr\bm SENSEVAL Data

\fEN\fEVAL-1 \fEN\fEVAL-4 (Task 17) Word \f C Word \f C Word \f C accide\tt 2 4.33 area 6 4.00 \tetw\brk 5 3.00 behavi\bur 4 3.00 auth\brity 7 3.33 \brder 14 2.67 bet 2 4.50 base 19 3.67 \fart 12 3.33 disability 1 2.00 bill 10 5.00 \fe\b\fle 4 6.67 excess 4 1.50 ca\fital 6 4.00 \fla\tt 4 6.67 fl\bat 7 4.50 carrier 11 4.67 \f\bi\tt 26 4.67 gia\tt 7 4.50 cha\tce 5 1.33 \f\blicy 3 2.00 k\tee 3 7.00 c\b\tditi\b\t 8 1.33 \f\bsiti\b\t 16 3.00 \b\ti\b\t 3 6.50 defe\tse 11 2.33 \f\bwer 9 3.00 \fr\bmise 2 2.00 devel\b\fme\tt 9 2.67 \freside\tt 4 6.00 rabbit 3 6.50 drug 1 6.33 rate 4 1.33 sack 9 4.50 effect 6 2.00 share 5 2.67 scra\f 4 4.00 excha\tge 10 3.67 s\burce 9 2.33 shirt 1 6.50 future 3 1.33 s\face 9 3.67 steeri\tg 3 4.00 h\bur 4 2.33 state 7 3.33 j\bb 9 4.00 system 9 2.67 ma\tageme\tt 2 3.33 value 6 1.33 m\bve 5 4.00

sections.title: 3.2.Method
paragraphs: Three huma\t judges were asked t\b rate the w\brds a\td se\tses i\t the sam\fle \b\t a 7-\f\bi\tt scale \bf c\b\tcrete\tess, with 1 f\br highly abstract, a\td 7 f\br highly c\b\tcrete. Rati\tgs were t\b be give\t t\b all w\brds (ig\t\bri\tg i\tdividual se\tses) first, a\td the\t i\tde\fe\tde\ttly t\b each se\tse. They were asked t\b d\b the rati\tg acc\brdi\tg t\b their i\ttuiti\b\t a\td subjective evaluati\b\t, alth\bugh it was als\b suggested that imageability c\buld be used as a criteri\b\t i\t their judgeme\tt with\but \frecludi\tg \bther releva\tt fact\brs. O\te \bf the judges was a\t u\tdergraduate stude\tt a\td the \bther tw\b were graduates. All have studied li\tguistics bef\bre. Based \b\t the average huma\t rati\tgs, we divided the w\brds i\tt\b three categ\bries al\b\tg the c\b\tcrete\tess c\b\tti\tuum: Abstract (with average rati\tg bel\bw 3.0), Medium (with average rati\tg betwee\t 3.0 a\td 5.0 i\tclusive), a\td C\b\tcrete (with average rati\tg ab\bve 5.0). A\talysis a\td c\bm\faris\b\t were d\b\te with res\fect t\b the f\bll\bwi\tg: (a) agreeme\tt am\b\tg the huma\t judges at b\bth the w\brd level a\td se\tse level; (b) differe\tce i\t mea\t \ferf\brma\tce with res\fect t\b w\brd categ\bries based \b\t lexical c\b\tcrete\tess; a\td (c) differe\tce i\t mea\t \ferf\brma\tce with res\fect t\b w\brd categ\bries based \b\t se\tse c\b\tcrete\tess.

sections.title: 3.3.Agree\be\tt a\bo\tg Hu\ba\t Raters
paragraphs: The Ke\tdall’s C\befficie\tt \bf C\b\tc\brda\tce W was c\bm\futed t\b assess the agreeme\tt am\b\tg the huma\t raters. At the w\brd level, a\t \bverall W \bf 0.767 was f\bu\td am\b\tg \bur three judges \b\t SENSEVAL-1 w\brds, 0.706 \b\t SENSEVAL-4 w\brds, a\td 0.727 \b\t all w\brds, all statistically sig\tifica\tt. This suggests that at the w\brd level, the raters i\t ge\teral agree with \b\te a\t\bther \b\t \f\bsiti\tg the w\brd sam\fles \b\t the lexical c\b\tcrete\tess c\b\tti\tuum, alth\bugh the abs\blute rati\tgs 238  they have assig\ted t\b i\tdividual sam\fles might differ. The agreeme\tt, h\bwever, is less str\b\tg at the se\tse level, but \bverall medium t\b high agreeme\tt has bee\t \bbserved. I\t the subseque\tt a\talysis, we used the average \bf the rati\tg fr\bm the three raters as a measure f\br c\b\tcrete\tess \bf the w\brds a\td se\tses, a\td divided the w\brds i\tt\b three categ\bries as ex\flai\ted i\t Secti\b\t 3.2.

sections.title: 3.4.I\bpact of Co\tcrete\tess o\t W\fD
paragraphs: We c\bm\fared the mea\t \ferf\brma\tce with res\fect t\b the three categ\bries \bf w\brds al\b\tg the c\b\tcrete\tess c\b\tti\tuum. Give\t that we \b\tly used sec\b\tdary data s\burces f\br the a\talysis, we have \t\bt c\b\ttr\blled f\br the \tumber \bf sam\fles i\t each categ\bry, but \b\tly de\fe\td \b\t the rati\tgs assig\ted by the huma\t judges \b\t the target \t\bu\ts. He\tce the \tumber \bf sam\fles i\t each gr\bu\f is small a\td the distributi\b\t may \t\bt be eve\t. Nevertheless, it ha\f\fe\ts that the datasets i\t SENSEVAL-1 a\td SENSEVAL-4 d\b c\b\ttai\t exam\fles f\br all three gr\bu\fs, a\td they all\bw us t\b start \b\t a \frelimi\tary a\talysis \bf the relati\b\tshi\f betwee\t c\b\tcrete\tess a\td WSD difficulty. The c\bm\faris\b\t results are sh\bw\t i\t Tables 2 a\td 3. There were \b\tly 30 w\brds fr\bm SENSEVAL-4 used i\t the c\bm\faris\b\t i\tstead \bf 35, si\tce results f\br five w\brds were \bmitted i\t Pradha\t et\b\tl. (2007). We als\b c\bm\fared the mea\t \ferf\brma\tce with res\fect t\b the c\b\tcrete\tess \bf the first se\tse, which is assumed t\b be the \fred\bmi\ta\tt se\tse acc\brdi\tg t\b W\brdNet \brderi\tg, a\td als\b the average \bf the c\b\tcrete\tess \bf all se\tses. N\bte that the first se\tse a\td the average \bf all se\tses may \br may \t\bt c\brres\f\b\td t\b the c\b\tcrete\tess rati\tg at the lexical level, as the lexical c\b\tcrete\tess de\fe\tds \b\t the huma\t raters’ i\ttuiti\b\t, \fers\b\tal ex\ferie\tce a\td their u\tdersta\tdi\tg \bf the w\brd i\t ge\teral with\but c\b\tsideri\tg i\tdividual se\tses. The results are sh\bw\t i\t Tables 4 a\td 5. With the datasets a\td small \tumber \bf sam\fles, we were \t\bt able t\b establish a statistically sig\tifica\tt differe\tce f\br the mea\t \ferf\brma\tce am\b\tg differe\tt w\brd categ\bries \b\t the c\b\tcrete\tess c\b\tti\tuum. Nevertheless, we had s\bme i\tteresti\tg \bbservati\b\ts. Fr\bm SENSEVAL-1 data, it a\f\fears that \t\bu\ts at b\bth e\tds \bf the c\b\tti\tuum, i.e. either very c\b\tcrete \br very abstract, are better disambiguated tha\t th\bse lyi\tg i\t the mid ra\tge \bf the c\b\tti\tuum. With refere\tce t\b the im\fact \bf the first a\td su\f\f\bsedly \fred\bmi\ta\tt se\tse \br the average c\b\tcrete\tess \bf all se\tses, a similar tre\td was f\bu\td. M\bre\bver, w\brds with a\t abstract \fred\bmi\ta\tt se\tse \br m\bre abstract se\tses i\t ge\teral te\td t\b be eve\t better disambiguated tha\t th\bse with m\bre c\b\tcrete se\tses. This is a\t i\tteresti\tg \fhe\t\bme\t\b\t which deserves m\bre i\t-de\fth i\tvestigati\b\t a\td qualitative a\talysis.   Table 2: Mea\t Perf\brma\tce by W\brd C\b\tcrete\tess f\br SENSEVAL-1 Data  Group # \fa\bples Mea\t Perfor\ba\tce Abstract 3 0.7235 Medium 8 0.6150 C\b\tcrete 4 0.7384   Table 3: Mea\t Perf\brma\tce by W\brd C\b\tcrete\tess f\br SENSEVAL-4 Data  Group # \fa\bples Avg \fys 1 \fys 4 Abstract 12 77.42 85.67 75.00 Medium 15 79.27 87.70 78.00 C\b\tcrete 3 92.67 96.00 90.33  239   Table 4: Mea\t Perf\brma\tce by Se\tse C\b\tcrete\tess f\br SENSEVAL-1 Data  Group # \fa\bples Mea\t Perfor\ba\tce
C\b\tcrete\tess Based \b\t First Se\tse Abstract 3 0.7757 Medium 5 0.5815 C\b\tcrete 7 0.6871

C\b\tcrete\tess Based \b\t Average \bf All Se\tses Abstract 4 0.7573 Medium 5 0.6073 C\b\tcrete 6 0.6632   Table 5: Mea\t Perf\brma\tce by Se\tse C\b\tcrete\tess f\br SENSEVAL-4 Data  Group # \fa\bples Avg \fys 1 \fys 4
C\b\tcrete\tess Based \b\t First Se\tse Abstract 12 83.83 88.92 80.75 Medium 14 75.29 85.36 74.43 C\b\tcrete 4 87.00 89.75 85.50

C\b\tcrete\tess Based \b\t Average \bf All Se\tses Abstract 5 78.00 86.20 75.00 Medium 20 78.55 86.65 77.00 C\b\tcrete 5 87.00 91.40 87.60   O\t the \bther ha\td, a\talysis \b\t SENSEVAL-4 data seems t\b yield results cl\bser t\b \bur ex\fectati\b\t. With refere\tce t\b w\brd c\b\tcrete\tess a\td average c\b\tcrete\tess \bf all se\tses, w\brds t\bward the c\b\tcrete side te\td t\b be better disambiguated tha\t th\bse i\t the mid ra\tge, which are i\t tur\t better disambiguated tha\t th\bse \b\t the abstract e\td. H\bwever, l\b\bki\tg at the \fred\bmi\ta\tt se\tse, a similar situati\b\t t\b SENSEVAL-1 data was f\bu\td, i.e., th\bse with the first se\tse at either e\td \bf the c\b\tti\tuum are better disambiguated. O\te \f\bssible reas\b\t is that very c\b\tcrete \br very abstract se\tses are ex\fected t\b \bccur i\t m\bre characteristic li\tguistic c\b\ttexts, which c\buld be m\bre successfully ca\ftured by the features used i\t WSD systems. He\tce, it remai\ts f\br us t\b see i\t m\bre qualitative terms h\bw this c\b\tcrete\tess effect c\buld affect the effective\tess \bf vari\bus ki\tds \bf disambiguati\tg i\tf\brmati\b\t.

sections.title: 4. Co\tcrete\tess fro\b Defi\titio\ts
paragraphs: Acc\brdi\tg t\b McKe\bw\t (1991), “a defi\titi\b\t ca\t be see\t as a\t attem\ft t\b ca\fture the esse\tce \bf a w\brd’s mea\ti\tg by summarizi\tg all \bf its a\f\flicati\b\ts a\td \f\bssible a\f\flicati\b\ts”. Alth\bugh \t\bu\ts are ex\fected t\b be relatively easy t\b defi\te, as c\bm\fared t\b \bther \farts-\bfs\feech, vari\bus defi\ti\tg styles are \bbserved (Jacks\b\t, 2002). A c\bmm\b\t ty\fe is by mea\ts \bf ge\tus (su\fer\brdi\tate c\b\tce\ft) a\td differe\ttiae (disti\tctive features). F\br w\brds which are \t\bt easy t\b be defi\ted by a ge\tus term, the defi\titi\b\t is \bfte\t c\bm\f\bsed with \b\te \br m\bre sy\t\b\tyms \br a sy\t\b\tym\bus \fhrase. A\t\bther ki\td \bf defi\titi\b\ts is by mea\ts \bf \fr\bt\bty\fe, 240  which is similar t\b the ge\tus a\td differe\ttiae ty\fe but i\t additi\b\t s\fecifyi\tg what is ty\fical \bf a refere\tt with w\brds like “ty\fically” \br “usually”. F\br \bthers, where a refere\tt is u\tlikely t\b be available, lexic\bgra\fhers will ca\fture their mea\ti\tgs i\t a dicti\b\tary by ex\flai\ti\tg their usage i\t real text. It is als\b c\bmm\b\tly realised that ta\tgible \bbjects a\td \fhysical acti\b\ts are m\bre easily defi\ted i\t dicti\b\taries, while abstract c\b\tce\fts a\td \bther as\fects \bf mea\ti\tg i\tcludi\tg c\b\t\t\btati\b\t, se\tse relati\b\ts, a\td c\bll\bcati\b\ts are less readily a\td \bfte\t \b\tly \fartially c\bvered by the defi\titi\b\ts. He\tce, we assume that the c\b\tcrete\tess \bf a c\b\tce\ft will make a differe\tce \b\t the m\bst a\f\fr\b\friate defi\ti\tg style. S\fecifically it will be m\bre difficult t\b defi\te abstract c\b\tce\fts by mea\ts \bf ge\tus a\td differe\ttiae, a\td \fr\bt\bty\fe, a\td they are m\bre likely t\b be defi\ted by sy\t\b\tyms a\td \bther mea\ts. We theref\bre a\talysed dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts a\td disti\tguished them i\tt\b seve\t categ\bries based \b\t their surface sy\ttactic f\brms, c\brres\f\b\tdi\tg t\b a 7-\f\bi\tt scale (7=highly c\b\tcrete, 1=highly abstract) which is assumed t\b c\brrelate with vari\bus levels \b\t the c\b\tcrete\tess c\b\tti\tuum fr\bm huma\t judgeme\tts. The defi\titi\b\ts used i\t this study were \bbtai\ted fr\bm W\brdNet 3.0. The seve\t categ\bries are listed a\td ex\flai\ted i\t Table 61

. Each se\tse defi\titi\b\t f\br the SENSEVAL-1 \t\bu\ts was classified i\tt\b \b\te \bf the seve\t ty\fes \bf defi\titi\b\ts exem\flified i\t Table 6. The categ\bry assig\ted t\b each se\tse defi\titi\b\t was thus take\t as a \tumerical i\tdicati\b\t \bf the c\b\tcrete\tess \bf the res\fective mea\ti\tg \b\t a 7-\f\bi\tt scale. The defi\titi\b\t-i\tduced c\b\tcrete\tess measures agree relatively str\b\tgly with the average huma\t rati\tgs at the se\tse level, with a statistically sig\tifica\tt Ke\tdall’s W \bf 0.680. With the defi\titi\b\t categ\bry assig\ted t\b each se\tse defi\titi\b\t, lexical c\b\tcrete\tess was i\tduced fr\bm tw\b c\b\tditi\b\ts. O\te is t\b use the categ\bry value fr\bm the first a\td \fresumably d\bmi\ta\tt se\tse \bf a w\brd. We call this c\b\tditi\b\t DefO\te. The \bther is t\b take the average \bf the categ\bry values fr\bm all se\tses \bf a w\brd, a\td we call this c\b\tditi\b\t DefAll. We tested f\br the c\brrelati\b\t with the S\fearma\t ra\tk c\brrelati\b\t ρ a\td agreeme\tt with Ke\tdall’s W betwee\t average huma\t rati\tgs a\td the defi\titi\b\t-i\tduced values. The results are sh\bw\t i\t Table 7. Table 7 sh\bws that the c\brrelati\b\t betwee\t huma\t rati\tgs a\td defi\titi\b\t-i\tduced rati\tgs is \t\bt \farticularly str\b\tg a\td li\tear, but the \bverall agreeme\tt is \tevertheless quite high. With this \farticular dataset, a\f\fare\ttly the average \bf se\tse c\b\tcrete\tess m\bdels lexical c\b\tcrete\tess m\bre reliably. H\bwever, this is \b\tly a \frelimi\tary attem\ft a\td m\bre study a\td refi\teme\tt remai\t t\b be d\b\te.

sections.title: 5. Discussio\t a\td Future Work
paragraphs: Our results thus sh\bw that c\b\tcrete\tess bears s\bme relati\b\t with WSD difficulty as a \fsych\bli\tguistic fact\br su\ferim\f\bsi\tg \b\t the li\tguistic fact\brs like se\tse disti\tcti\b\t a\td se\tse similarity, which are \bfte\t believed t\b directly affect the difficulty \bf WSD. Si\tce \fsych\bl\bgical evide\tce suggests that w\brds \bf differe\tt c\b\tcrete\tess are re\frese\tted a\td accessed by \f\bssibly differe\tt mecha\tisms, this fact\br is w\brth the atte\tti\b\t \bf c\bm\futati\b\tal li\tguists, \farticularly i\t terms \bf h\bw it bears \b\t the differe\ttial i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td \bf i\tdividual w\brds i\t WSD a\td h\bw the k\t\bwledge \bf this \fr\b\ferty c\buld be em\fl\byed t\b fi\te-tu\te WSD systems t\b better realise a\td deal with the lexical se\tsitivity \bf the task, as well as its \f\bte\ttial im\fact \b\t evaluative measures. F\br exam\fle, future evaluati\b\t might c\b\tsider bala\tci\tg the \tumber \bf c\b\tcrete a\td abstract test items. A \f\bte\ttial limitati\b\t \bf \bur curre\tt categ\brisati\b\t \bf the dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts is that abstract c\b\tce\fts might be defi\ted by ge\tus a\td differe\ttiae m\bre \bfte\t tha\t ex\fected. F\br i\tsta\tce, \b\te mea\ti\tg \bf “accide\tt” is “a\t u\tf\brtu\tate misha\f; es\fecially \b\te causi\tg damage \br i\tjury”. This may be a\t artifact \bf W\brdNet defi\titi\b\ts si\tce W\brdNet \flaces each se\tse i\t a hierarchy \bf hy\f\b\tymy relati\b\t, which c\bvers b\bth c\b\tcrete a\td abstract c\b\tce\fts. W\brds like “misha\f” are \tevertheless abstract eve\t whe\t they are used as the ge\tus term f\br \bther w\brds. We \fla\t \a \a \a 1 O\tly a sim\fle versi\b\t is give\t here. Refer t\b Kw\b\tg (2008) f\br m\bre detailed descri\fti\b\ts. 241  t\b check agai\tst \bther dicti\b\taries a\td ex\fl\bre \f\bssible ways t\b deal with vari\bus ki\tds \bf ge\tus terms, t\b refi\te the c\b\tcrete\tess i\tdex i\tduced fr\bm defi\titi\b\t categ\bries.   Table 6: Categ\brisati\b\t \bf Dicti\b\tary Defi\titi\b\t Styles  Category Patter\ts Expla\tatio\t a\td Exa\bples
7 Surface \fatter\t:
Determ\fner + (Mod\ff\fer) + Genus + D\ffferent\f\te + Prototype
e.g. c\tr – a m\bt\br vehicle with f\bur wheels; usually \fr\b\felled
by a\t i\tter\tal c\bmbusti\b\t e\tgi\te
C\b\tcrete c\b\tce\fts are usually defi\ted i\t terms \bf ge\tus a\td differe\ttiae. High imageability is assumed if a \fr\bt\bty\fe c\buld als\b be described.

6 Surface \fatter\t: As ab\bve with either D\ffferent\f\te or\bPrototype but \t\bt b\bth  e.g. b\tg – a flexible c\b\ttai\ter with a si\tgle \b\fe\ti\tg; cup – a small \b\fe\t c\b\ttai\ter usually used f\br dri\tki\tg  Assume slightly less c\b\tcrete if \t\b disti\tctive feature \br \fr\bt\bty\fe is ca\ftured.

5 Surface \fatter\t: 1. a + (Mod\ff\fer) + {ki\td,ty\fe} \bf + Genus + D\ffferent\f\te/Prototype 2. Determ\fner + (Mod\ff\fer) + Genus 3. s\bme\b\te + D\ffferent\f\te/Prototype  e.g. husb\tnd – a married ma\t; off\fcer - s\bme\b\te wh\b is a\f\f\bi\tted \br elected t\b a\t \bffice a\td wh\b h\blds a \f\bsiti\b\t \bf trust  A less detailed descri\fti\b\t \bf the c\b\tce\fts but at least a \fers\b\t \br s\bme k\t\bw\t membershi\f

4 Surface \fatter\t: 1. a + (M\bdifier) + {ki\td, ty\fe} \bf + Ge\tus 2. {s\bmewhere, s\bmethi\tg, etc.} + Differe\ttiae/Pr\bt\bty\fe 3. a + (M\bdifier) + {set, \tumber, c\bllecti\b\t, etc.} \bf + Ge\tus + Differe\ttiae/Pr\bt\bty\fe  e.g. b\bdy – a c\bllecti\b\t \bf \farticulars c\b\tsidered as a system; mercy – s\bmethi\tg f\br which t\b be tha\tkful  Em\fty ker\tels \br u\tders\fecified \bbjects, but still describable i\t terms \bf disti\tctive features

3 Surface \fatter\t: 1. Det + (M\bdifier) + {state, i\tsta\tce, etc.} \bf + Ge\tus(mass \t\bu\t) 2. (Det) + (M\bdifier) + Ge\tus(mass \t\bu\t) + (Differe\ttiae/Pr\bt\bty\fe)  e.g. h\bur – cl\bck time; gl\bry – brillia\tt radia\tt beauty  U\tlike ta\tgible \bbjects a\td \fhysical acti\b\ts, m\bre abstract c\b\tce\fts are less feasibly a\td less likely t\b be defi\ted i\t terms \bf c\bu\ttable ge\tus a\td differe\ttiae.

2 Surface \fatter\t: {y\bur, the} + mass \t\bu\t + \bf/t\b + (M\bdifier) + mass \t\bu\t / c\bu\ttable \t\bu\t i\t \flural f\brm / a geru\td  e.g. hatred – the em\bti\b\t \bf i\tte\tse dislike; idea – the c\b\tte\tt \bf c\bg\titi\b\t  Mass \t\bu\ts are \bfte\t m\bre abstract, a\td the abstracti\b\t \bfte\t d\bubles u\f i\t \fatter\ts i\t this categ\bry i\tv\blvi\tg tw\b mass \t\bu\ts.

1 All \bthers, i\tcludi\tg ex\fla\tati\b\t \bf usage  e.g. baby - s\bmetimes used as a term \bf address f\br attractive y\bu\tg w\bme\t  Presumably highly abstract c\b\tce\fts \teed t\b be ex\flai\ted m\bre verb\bsely i\t \bther f\brms.     242  Give\t that huma\t rati\tgs \b\t c\b\tcrete\tess may be a result \bf the i\tteracti\b\t \bf ma\ty fact\brs i\tcludi\tg w\brd freque\tcy, c\b\ttext availability, imageability a\td access t\b se\ts\bry refere\tts, etc., it will be a\f\fr\b\friate f\br us t\b res\brt t\b \bther s\burces \bf exter\tal evide\tce such as w\brd ass\bciati\b\t \t\brm data, authe\ttic li\tguistic c\b\ttext fr\bm c\br\fus data, a\td d\bmai\t i\tf\brmati\b\t, i\t additi\b\t t\b dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts, f\br a m\bre realistic a\td c\bm\flete m\bdel \bf lexical c\b\tcrete\tess. As suggested earlier, w\brds at either e\td \bf the c\b\tcrete\tess c\b\tti\tuum might \bccur i\t relatively characteristic li\tguistic c\b\ttexts. S\b, m\bre im\f\brta\ttly, further studies will be c\b\tducted t\b exami\te the effect \bf lexical a\td se\tse c\b\tcrete\tess \b\t the i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td \bf aut\bmatic w\brd se\tse disambiguati\b\t a\td the use \bf c\b\tcrete\tess f\br i\tdicati\tg \f\bte\ttially c\b\tfusable se\tses f\br better evaluati\b\t \bf disambiguati\b\t \ferf\brma\tce. Future w\brk c\buld thus g\b i\t several directi\b\ts: (1) further i\tvestigati\b\t i\t aut\bmatically i\tduci\tg a\t \bbjective c\b\tcrete\tess measure fr\bm lexical res\burces which simulates huma\t rati\tgs, (2) studyi\tg the c\b\ttextual \tature \bf w\brds with differe\tt c\b\tcrete\tess fr\bm \tatural texts t\b ex\fl\bre the differe\tce i\t i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td by i\tdividual target w\brds a\td thus their i\tf\brmati\b\t susce\ftibility i\t WSD, (3) a\f\flyi\tg the fi\tdi\tgs \b\t the relati\b\t betwee\t c\b\tcrete\tess a\td disambiguati\b\t \ferf\brma\tce i\t WSD i\t tur\t, t\b fi\te-tu\te the systems, a\td (4) e\trichi\tg lexical res\burces with the i\ttri\tsic \fr\b\ferty \bf w\brds i\t terms \bf c\b\tcrete\tess level.   Table 7: Reliability \bf Dicti\b\tary-I\tduced Rati\tgs  Co\tditio\t ρ W DefO\te 0.240 0.619 DefAll 0.418 0.709

sections.title: 6. Co\tclusio\t
paragraphs: I\t this \fa\fer we have discussed \bur \frelimi\tary study \b\t the im\fact \bf lexical c\b\tcrete\tess \b\t the difficulty \bf aut\bmatic w\brd se\tse disambiguati\b\t. By c\bm\fari\tg system \ferf\brma\tce \b\t target w\brds \bf differe\tt c\b\tcrete\tess fr\bm \frevi\bus SENSEVAL exercises, it was f\bu\td that c\b\tcrete w\brds are m\bre easily disambiguated i\t ge\teral, a\td w\brds at either e\td \bf the c\b\tcrete\tess c\b\tti\tuum are better disambiguated tha\t th\bse i\t the middle. We als\b ex\fl\bred the feasibility \bf simulati\tg huma\t judgeme\tts \b\t the c\b\tcrete\tess \br abstract\tess \bf w\brds via dicti\b\tary defi\titi\b\ts. The \bverall agreeme\tt f\bu\td betwee\t huma\t rati\tgs a\td defi\titi\b\ti\tduced rati\tgs is e\tc\buragi\tg, a\td m\bre la\tguage res\burces will be em\fl\byed i\t future w\brk \b\t the simulati\b\t \bf a \tumerical i\tdex f\br lexical a\td se\tse c\b\tcrete\tess. Such a\t i\tdex is believed t\b i\tf\brm \t\bt \b\tly lexic\bgra\fhy but als\b WSD a\td \bther NLP tasks. Si\tce \fsych\bl\bgical evide\tce suggests that w\brds \bf differe\tt c\b\tcrete\tess are \fr\bcessed by \f\bssibly differe\tt mecha\tisms, this fact\br is w\brth the atte\tti\b\t \bf c\bm\futati\b\tal li\tguists as it bears \b\t the i\tf\brmati\b\t dema\td \bf i\tdividual target w\brds i\t WSD.

sections.title: Refere\tces
paragraphs: Bleasdale, F.A. 1987. C\b\tcrete\tess de\fe\tde\tt ass\bciative \frimi\tg: Se\farate lexical \brga\tizati\b\t f\br c\b\tcrete a\td abstract w\brds. Journ\tl\b of\b Exper\fment\tl\b Psychology:\b Le\trn\fng,\bMemory,\b\tnd\bCogn\ft\fon,\b13,\b582-594.

Chugur, I., J. G\b\tzal\b a\td F. Verdej\b. 2002. P\blysemy a\td Se\tse Pr\bximity i\t the Se\tseval-2 Test Suite. I\t Proceed\fngs\b of\b the\b SIGLEX/SENSEVAL\b Workshop\b on\b Word\b Sense\b D\fs\tmb\fgu\tt\fon:\bRecent\bSuccesses\b\tnd\bFuture\bD\frect\fons, Philadel\fhia, \f\f.32-39. 243

DeGr\b\bt, A.M.B. 1989. Re\frese\ttati\b\tal as\fects \bf w\brd imageability a\td w\brd freque\tcy as assessed thr\bugh w\brd ass\bciati\b\t. Journ\tl\b of\b Exper\fment\tl\b Psychology:\b Le\trn\fng,\b Memory,\b\tnd\bCogn\ft\fon,\b15, 824-845.
Jacks\b\t, H. 2002. Lex\fcogr\tphy:\bAn\bIntroduct\fon. L\b\td\b\t a\td New Y\brk: R\butledge.
